results.title: Plan 9 from outer space = Grave robbers from outer space
results.creator_credit: Edward Wood Jr and Reynolds Pictures
results.brief_description: The local authorities join forces with the military to ward off an invasion of flying saucers. Undeterred, the aliens continue their attempt to conquer Earth by resurrecting corpses from a San Fernando cemetery. “Plan 9 from outer space” has been described as the worst film ever made. This dubious honour has led to the cult status and notoriety the film enjoys to this day, proving that any publicity is good publicity. Those who have seen Tim Burton’s homage, “Ed Wood”, will enjoy seeing this original masterpiece. Bela Lugosi played the definitive vampire as Count Dracula in Tod Browning’s 1931 classic horror. In “Plan 9”, he revives his ghoulish persona in this, his final screen role.

results.title: Love serenade
results.creator_credit: Shirley Barrett, Jan Chapman, AFFC and Saddleback Productions
results.brief_description: Two bored sisters Dimity and Vicki-Ann live in a small country town. Their new neighbour, a brooding self-centered radio personality arrives on the scene and threatens to turn their world upside down. Dimity and Vicki-Ann find themselves in competition for his affections as each develops a severe crush on the aging Lothario with a predilection for ‘70’s music and young women. Awarded the Camera D’Or at the 1996 Cannes Film Festival and starring Miranda Otto and Rebecca Frith (as the love-torn sisters) alongside George Shevtsov and John Alansu. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.

results.title: Mighty Ducks 2
results.creator_credit: Sam Weisman, Jon Avnet, Jordan Kerner and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Emilio Estevez returns in another heartwarming comedy about the Mighty Ducks; an ice-hockey team full of misfit teenagers with the desire to be the best they can be. The team win an opportunity to represent their country in the Junior Goodwill Games to be held in Los Angeles. Two challenges await them - the fierce competition in the form of the team from Iceland and resisting the Hollywood glitz and glamour which threatens to tear them apart. Only team spirit will help them overcome these obstacles.

results.title: Rob Roy
results.creator_credit: Michael Caton-Jones, Richard Jackson, Peter Broughan and Talisman
results.brief_description: When a harsh winter threatens the majestic Scottish Highlands, Robert Roy McGregor (Liam Neeson) is forced to borrow money from the not so noble Marquis of Montrose (John Hurt) to provide for his clan. But when Montrose’s evil henchmen (brilliantly portrayed by Tim Roth and Brian Cox) conspire to take the wealth for themselves, they thrust Rob into the most challenging battle of his life, one that escalates into a bloody and gripping climax. Breathtaking landscapes, steamy romance and non-stop action combine to make this a thrilling and powerful adventure.

results.title: Presumed innocent
results.creator_credit: Alan Pakula, Mark Rosenberg, Sydney Pollack and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: This courtroom drama based on the Scott Turow novel of the same name contains murder, sex and intrigue. It stars Harrison Ford as the prosecutor, Rusty Sabich, who is asked to investigate the murder of a colleague. He is reluctant to do so because he has had a previous affair with her. What follows is a twisted tale of suspense and surprise. Supporting cast includes Brian Dennehy, Raul Julia, Bonnie Bedelia, Paul Winfield and Greta Scacchi. Music by John Williams.

results.title: Bullets over Broadway
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut, Sweetland Films BV and Magnolia Productions
results.brief_description: A struggling writer gets the opportunity of his life to stage his latest play on Broadway. There is one catch however: he must cast the untalented mistress of a notorious gangster in the lead role. Overwhelmed by the chance of success, he overlooks critical factors looming in the wings, including a player who can’t act, a leading lady wanting to steal the spotlight, a leading man who is a compulsive eater and the gangster’s bodygaurd who wants to rewrite the play. Set in the 1920’s, Woody Allen’s film is enhanced by an excellent atmospheric soundtrack. The cast includes John Cusack, Mary-Louise Parker, Jennifer Tilly, Tracey Ullman, and Academy Award winner Dianne Wiest.

results.title: The Blue kite
results.brief_description: The fate of a Beijing family under Mao Tse Tung’s regime from the early 1950’s to the Cultural Revolution is the focus of this film by talented filmaker Tian Zhuangzhuang. Seen from the perspective of Tietou who grows from child to adolescence as he observes his mother’s three marriages. Although epic in proportion, the intimacy of domestic life is a poignant contrast to the political dramas occuring. The film was banned in China but a print was smuggled out of the country allowing the rest of the world an opportunity to experience this inspirational human drama.

results.title: Street fighter II: the animated movie
results.creator_credit: Gisaburo Sugii, Kenichi Imai and Capcom Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the popular video game of the same name. Human civilisation is under attack in the not so distant future. Bison is the evil mastermind who leads the forces of evil and wants to take possession of the world’s best fighters so he can use them to conquer the world. Ken and Ryu are the only two humans in the world with the skill and strength to stop them. What ensues is a mighty battle in the classic clash between the forces of good and evil.

results.title: The Madness of King George
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Nicholas Hytner, David Parfitt, Stephen Evans and Close Call Film Production
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Alan Bennett, “The Madness of King George” stars Nigel Hawthorne as the ailing King and Helen Mirren as his wife Queen Charlotte. King George the Third, after he lost the American colonies in the War of Independence, succumbed to intermittent bouts of madness where his usual ordered and calm persona underwent a violent and obscene transformation. The Prince of Wales becomes a willing pawn in the plot to commit the King, and establish the Regency. This is a finely acted and sumptuous production of Bennett’s play. Ian Holm plays the Doctor called in to cure the King’s madness using methods which from a modern vantage were brutal and inhumane.

results.title: Shine
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Jane Scott and Momentum Films
results.brief_description: The award winning film “Shine” tells the remarkable story of pianist David Helfgott. As a child prodigy he was expected to have a brilliant career, but a nervous breakdown on the brink of international success meant that he was institutionalised and without access to the instrument which he loved so much. His voyage out of that darkness into a life which became filled with love, is truly inspirational. Noah Taylor and Geoffrey Rush give exceptional performances as Helfgott, while Armin Mueller-Stahl who plays David’s father is outstanding. “Shine” was a triumph internationally for both the Australian film industry and the relaunching of Helfgott’s career. It is also a testament to the courage of human beings facing adversity and overcome it. Geoffrey Rush received an Academy Award for his outstanding performance.
